newsitem.title: ITALY: Italy Treasury to issue new 18-month CTZ mid-Jan.
newsitem.headline: Italy Treasury to issue new 18-month CTZ mid-Jan.

text.p: The Italian Treasury said it would issue a new zero coupon certificate (CTZ) with a duration of 18 months in mid-January 1997.
A Treasury statement said the new issue would be alongside the traditional 24-month CTZs, and its auction timetable would coincide with short-term bills (BOTS) and two-year CTZs.
It would also issue in mid-January a new seven-year floating rate certificate (CCT) expiring January 1, 2004 with a minimum quantity of 9.0 trillion lire.
